content: Hmm… I don’t know, based on the article, it seems against precedent to pull your money out because a company makes a political move you either disagree with or think is bad for business — but, as a casual observer it doesn’t seem reasonable. Personally, I was at the Women’s March, and if it was me I’d encourage the woman to post the pictures. But, it’s not hard to see where it could be questionable as a business decision and I could see someone wanting to pull their money out. Also, it doesn’t have to do specifically with this article, but I kind of wish they interviewed some white dudes to see if something similar ever happened to them? I mean, L.L. Bean got in big trouble because one member of a large board was a Trump supporter. I’m not saying it’s the case, but it doesn’t seem implausible that these people would make similar demands on a white guy if he used the company as a platform for an overtly political statement.
